website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few minor flaws, this catnip toy offers the unique concept of being refillable. Many kitties find it irresistible.
pros: Features a cute hedgehog with a hidden compartment for catnip
Doesn't have stuffing that can be torn out or ingested
Comes with a tube of catnip
cons: Some cats tend to pull out the faux fur fibers
A few owners wish this toy were a bit bigger, and several cats ignored it

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm buying my 2nd Mr Squirrel. My cat loves this toy. He "kills" it every night and drags it all around carrying on like he is a mighty hunter. He drowns it at least 3 x week in his water bowel and after 3 yrs it still looks great. He brings it on the bed at night and Mr Squirrel sleeps with us. I love all Kong products!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharri

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it! Refillable & machine washable!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this toy! I could barely get it out of the package before two of them tried to steal it right out of my hands. My favorite thing about it, besides the excellent price I got it at ($2.49 as an add-on item), is that it's washable and refillable. After it gets gross from my cats loving it to death, I can put it in the washing machine and it comes out like new. Being able to add fresh catnip makes it more appealing to my cats as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Beaver Refillable Catnip Toy for my kitties to play with. It comes with catnip so you can fill the toy up as full as it will allow. It has a velcro strip on its belly where you place the catnip. My kitties really like this toy. They will bite it, throw it up in the air, and chase it. I love buying them new toys and this one seems to be a hit. If you find my review helpful please let me know and if you have any questions or comments, feel free to post them below and I will answer them as quickly as possible. Thank you for checking out my review. :)
customer_reviews.author: ❤️AlleyCat❤️

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: Hope has deformed back legs (congenital defect) and doesn't play much although the vets have said she is not in pain. This toy gets her moving! She adores it. Hope loves it and it is her favorite toy; our other kitten doesn't pay attention to it much but loves his Catit Play Circuit as his favorite. Between the Kong Beaver and the Catit Play Circuit, the kittens are busy! Best 2 cat toys!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: A cat toy should not result in puncture wounds and blood
customer_reviews.text: The "catnip" included is filled with sharp-as-metal stems that, if not filtered out, will poke through the toy and stab the cat in the tongue/throat. Trust me, my cat had a mouth covered with blood and it took only a minute to realize what had happened. If I could, I would take the catnip and ask the seller to poke their mouth with it to see what it feels like. Not fun. A cat toy should not result in puncture wounds and blood. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: A fan

customer_reviews.title: OK product, but my cats ignore it
customer_reviews.text: Seems like an OK product. The pocket to stuff catnip in is a little small, so catnip gets in the velcro then it doesn't seal shut as well. It's cute and soft but I'm surprised -- my kitties don't play with it! I guess they like the old torn up mousey toy that has a catnip pouch. They LOVE that but it's def on its way out, so I thought I'd replace it. Maybe in time they'll learn to love it, but it has been like 3 months already. Oh well. They have lots of toys. If you don't have lots of kitty toys maybe try this one! They might like it. Maybe my kitties are too spoiled lol
customer_reviews.author: Birdie Kount

customer_reviews.title: Cute, cute, cute!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very finicky cat ( some of you may know what I am talking about. ;-) Out of every 10 toys I bring her home, she likes....NONE of them <sigh>! I am serious, this is one tough kitten to make happy. Well, Mom finally came through! She discovered Kong's refillable little animals (beaver), and Kitty loves these little guys. She also likes the little squirrel by Kong. I cannot tell you how happy it makes me to see this toy in her mouth and watch her play fight with it. What a hoot! I find this Beaver all over the house in the oddest places. This toy is a no brainier...get it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Oceanfront

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves her little squirrel toy
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this cat toy a solid four stars. My cat really seems to like it, but after one day the tail looks matted and gross, although that isn't completely unexpected. She seems to have trouble knowing that there is actually cat nip in it though. She's older, but loves her cat nip like nothing else. She comes running whenever she hears the container open. But she sort of just stares at the toy after I put it down, like she's still waiting for it. Only after I run it all over the outside does she seem to realize it's there. Maybe this is how these toys are supposed to work, I'm not sure, but she does like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Fae

customer_reviews.title: Kitten loves it!
customer_reviews.text: **Update** We bought this toy back in July for our new kitten and 3months later she still loves it! She plays with it every single day, throwing it around, biting it, carrying it around - still in one piece! This was the best toy we have ever gotten her and for the price, no complaints! Bought for our kitten and it's perfect size for her but idk if it would work for an adult cat. So far she loves it. Will have to update later on in regard to durability. I hope it lasts as she seems to love it
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoGirl🏔

customer_reviews.title: Katanna loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cats most favorite toy! She plays with it constantly. She even places it beside her food dish when she eats. I'll put it up a few days and she crys looking for it, but when I give it back, she's overjoyed! I'm going to buy a couple more in this series (of similar size) and see if she takes to them the same as this one or if it's just this particular (brown beaver) one she loves so much. It can be rather off putting though when you first get it because it rather looks like a little mouse only with a wider tail! 😂
customer_reviews.author: Red Head Bohemian

customer_reviews.title: Cute and My Cat Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this hedgehog catnip toy. She licks it and rolls on it regularly, and it is quite cute. However, it is smaller than I anticipated and I was disappointed since it cost the same as the larger ones I have ordered previously. Also, if you have a cat that attempts to tear it up, I"m not sure it would withstand that. My kittens prefer to destroy theirs so this one would probably not last long with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marih

customer_reviews.title: I mean, it does work...
customer_reviews.text: While sitting in your garage. However, once you start driving around, things fall apart. For instance, any interference from a legit radio station causes it to lose its frequency setting... which is kind of a pain in the butt while driving. It also doesn't seem to fast charge devices, which isn't why I bought it, but annoying. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was still $3 w/ free shipping
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has several similar toys, but he loved to chew on this little beaver. Sadly these toys can only take so much chewing before the catnip pouch stops staying closed. I got this one for less then $3 and free shipping, now the total is $9+. I just can't pay triple price, but if it comes down, I'd buy several of them.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Both of my cats have preferred this catnip toy over all their others
customer_reviews.text: My cat's favorite catnip-fillable toy, possibly because of its easy-to-carry tail. And it's my favorite as well, because his refillable mice all have too much faux wool or fur on them, which I'm always afraid he'll lick or chew off and swallow. This KONG beaver was also a favorite of my previous, now departed cat's. I guess all cats know quality when they see it!
customer_reviews.author: Jo G

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Cat and Owner, too!
customer_reviews.text: Probably my 7yo tuxedo cat's FAVORITE toy. I hide it in his tree and every morning he has it down on the floor, apparently showing off his skill in retrieving it. He liked the catnip at first, but I don't think he cares about that now. It's like a teddy bear for a little kid; he can't stand to be without it! Also of note: This toy has held up pretty well over 2-3 months. A definite improvement over the little fabric mice, which he destroys much more quickly. Definitely a cool toy. Would absolutely buy again, if this one ever wears out.
customer_reviews.author: PC-G

customer_reviews.title: She liked it for a little while but got bored quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a large catnip Christmas mouse toy for my cat. Because it was larger there was a lot of stuffing between the outside of the toy and where you put the catnip. She liked it for a little while but got bored quickly because it was too big to carry around and I'd imagine the smell wasn't very strong because of the stuffing. These toys do not have a bunch of stuffing. There's a good size pouch to put the catnip in and she will play with them constantly. 6 months later this toy is still in good condition despite her being rough on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: my cat's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this toy. The refillable catnip feature is very convenient with a velcro sealed seam to hold the catnip securely in the toy. My cat loves carrying this toy around the house, and it's the only thing she plays with regularly. I also think this toy is nice because the texture is varied with different materials. The catnip is of decent quality and goes a long way. We have not even made a dent in the refill tube yet. We are on our second hedgehog toy because our dog chewed up our first. He thought it was his because our cat accidentally left it in his bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty catnip for lots of refills, easy open, secure close
customer_reviews.text: Hahahaha My cat has never had catnip before and she is addicted to this in less than one day! It's easy to fill with velcro on the underside and I only put a pinch of catnip from the vial inside it and it was more than enough for her. The only thing I would change is less absorbable materials like the fabric / fur on the outside. It's really slobbery after she plays with it for a minute or two and I don't really want to touch it to take it away from her and give her a break. Very small price to pay for such entertainment!
customer_reviews.author: Naders13

customer_reviews.title: One of my cat's favorites
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this toy (she lost the first one so this is the second one I've purchased). We have other toys with feathers but out of all of them, she only plays with KONG brand and usually only this one. It's long enough that it looks like she's carrying a real mouse around and there have been quite a few times I've caught her with her face buried in the feathers. She actually carries it upstairs at night when she comes to bed with me. She hates catnip and particularly dislikes the KONG catnip for some reason, so obviously I leave it out. It doesn't come pre-loaded, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Countess Chocula

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy. I ordered two this time - one as a replacement, as the toy is threadbare from use, and one as a gift. They arrived today, and the inside of the box was covered in catnip, as were the squirrels. The tubes that contain the catnip did not have secure lids, and they came off during shipment. The majority of the catnip cannot be salvaged - it is embedded in the squirrels' fur and is difficult to get out of the box. Will order again in the future because it's a great toy, but was disappointed by this shipment.
customer_reviews.author: ptarzan80

customer_reviews.title: Some Types Are Too Small To Hold Any Catnip
customer_reviews.text: The body on the teddy bear in PJs, which we received instead of the ordered bunny in pjs is too small to open up, let alone make room for more than a tiny pinch of catnip. Otherwise this is a great little toy and a particular kitty of ours who demands soft toys is very happy. NOTE: years ago we did buy the stuffable turtle from KONG and that was a great success until it disappeared.... I think I would go for that one as it is a more generous size and holds a lot more catnip than the bunny or teddy.
customer_reviews.author: RickDeckard

customer_reviews.title: Very, very small. Small pets may choke.
customer_reviews.text: Very small, alot smaller than photo. It's also very difficult to fill with catnip. I have very small hands and fingers and I couldn't fill this. I ended up using a tiny piece of foil to get it to 1/4 filled. Final issue before getting rid of this, is my small dog plays with the cats' toys. Luckily, I saw him biting and chewing it, but then watched as he began choking on it because he tried to swallow it. Yes, it's that small. However, this is the first time I've been disappointed with KONG brand pet products.
customer_reviews.author: RyanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kitties, easy to refill
customer_reviews.text: Our kitties love this fun little re-fillable toy. They treat it like a small mouse toy, but then spend time after “catching it” licking it until it’s nearly drippy-wet. The Velcro closure is secure enough to prevent our middle-aged cats from popping it open. The catnip supplied in the initial product would allow for about three complete (but not tightly stuffed) refills. We’ve purchased the hedgehog and beaver variety. Both are equally beloved by our felines.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: I put catnip in this & press the Velcro together & give it to my cat Missy & the fun begins! She throws this in the air. She holds it between her paws. She loves on it, rolls & waller’s it & slobbers on it! She has the best time! It is just about 3 inches long & perfect for her. I have found it all over the bedroom & on the bed! Well worth the few dollars it cost! I love my little 12 year old girl! It is all worth it for her!!
customer_reviews.author: Anita Weigel Manis

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy. I got it when I realized my cat had nothing to play with, except all of the pens on my desk -__- I was a little skeptical that my cat would even be interested in this toy; in the past, she's all but ignored any actual cat toy I've gotten for her. However, when I filled the squirrel with catnip and showed it to her, she immediately started meowing and scratching at the squirrel. She's been playing with it frequently, and usually sleeps with it between her paws.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

customer_reviews.title: Good cat toy, the catnip is a tad dried out but can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Our cats we never really gave catnip. As younger animals they wanted nothing to do with it and would sniff and run. As adults, they aren't too bright.. they will eat the stuff right out of the container thus we needed a way to let them have fun but not have them throwing up catnip for hours. Our fat cat, Panda has taken to cleaning this toy and has claimed it as her own. It went MIA for a week and we found it on the top of the cat tower where she sleeps. Apparently even old cats can learn new tricks...
customer_reviews.author: Baka Baka

customer_reviews.title: Overall we're both satisfied with this product and I would recommend it to any cat owner!
customer_reviews.text: I have a total of 3 cats and one of them has a squirrel fetish so I bought this KONG Squirrel Catnip Toy for her as an early Christmas gift and she LOVES it! The squirrel has velcro on its belly that you can open up and place the catnip bag in. She goes wild over it with or without the catnip. The size of the squirrel is about 6.5" from its head to the tip of its tail and it is about 2 inches wide. It is a good size. I also bought her the Chipmunk, which she will get at Christmas ;) The KONG Squirrel was shipped quickly and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Our Households Reviews

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat's favorite toy, while she was alive. She just loved to play with her 'hedgy', either alone or as a game of pounce with me. Sadly, she died suddenly on 1st February. Bought 2 of these to put her ashes in, one for me and one for my boyfriend. Her toy was cremated with her. She's now always with us, and always has her favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile toy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are a heavy favorite of all our 3 cats. One cat specifically likes to pull out the feathers. The fact that we can refill the catnip is great. The only issues are the closure and the length of its life. The nip pocket is closed with Velcro. This makes putting in the nip rather messy. Second, these things get pretty disgusting over time. Still, the cats love them...
customer_reviews.author: Portia74

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED REVIEW!  The most adorable kitty toy ever. . . Kitty and Squirrel are inseparable:-)
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty sleeps with this adorable little Squirrel and gives it a bath. I think she thinks she is the squirrel's mama. (See picture attached). Almost six months later now and she still sleeps with her squirrel baby. So precious!
customer_reviews.author: A Prime memberTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: What is not to love about this hedgehog?!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived and before I could get it out of the package, my cat smelled it and wanted at it. Even the catnip that it came with was terrific. My cat is spoiled and has plenty of toys though right now this is a favorite...
customer_reviews.author: The dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Every cat I know loves this turtle
customer_reviews.text: This is the first toy my two year old cat has actually played with. I have friends who bought their cats the turtle and after watching endless videos of their cat playing with a stuffed turtle I decided my ladybird had to try. Success!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: my cat gets bored easily but he loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat immediately went for this toy and swatted it around and now he carries it around the apartment and snuggles the toy. He loves it! He is a 16 pound, domestic long hair male cat, and 6 years old! He loves new and fun items. This was such a great purchase! He loves it! I also like being able to refill the catnip to keep it fresh! he's a happy cat! When he's not swatting the toy around he's snuggling it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, durable, favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an identical replacement when we lost the original. This was my cat’s favorite toy. It wasn’t too big, so he would walk around with it and always have it with him. I lost him to cancer before this replacement came in (it was back-ordered), but he loved it so much I’m going to take the new one to a shelter for a cat that needs some extra love.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have two Australian shepherds. I bought this for my cats but they did not get much use out of it. My one Australian Shepherd does not chew, my other one is a puppy and does. My cat's did not get much use out of this because my Aussie decided it was her toy it lasted her a very long time for chewing though.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore

customer_reviews.title: Great toy at a wonderful value
customer_reviews.text: This came exactly as described and was a Christmas toy for our furry felines. They have loved most of the Kong refillable cat toys and though they enjoy this one, they still seem to prefer the Squirrel version the most due to the fluffy tail. We are on our third or fourth squirrel but hopefully this little beaver will become a favorite as well. Definitely recommend it for your cat as I love that you can empty and refill it with catnip for renewed interest for your kitty.
customer_reviews.author: MelG82

customer_reviews.title: Poor design makes this toy too hard to fill
customer_reviews.text: How long has this design been around, only years and years. Unfortunately, this company decided to take shortcuts on their design and made the opening so small it's almost impossible to fill the toy properly. Ugh. I can't recommend this "refillable" catnip toy. Sorry I bought it and wish I hadn't.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: The cat's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: For what it's worth, this is my cat's favorite toy. When the first one died from too much kitty lovin', I replaced it with another shape that was locally available. It was not nearly as well received, and ended up in a corner (taken and abandoned there by the cat). Both the cat and I were pleased to find this replacement at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Pentheseleia

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Cat LOVES this Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a finicky cat who either loves a toy or has no interest. There's no inbetween. I've even gotten other catnip toys for my cat and he has doesn't even look at it twice. My cat LOVES the Kong turtle. It's just the right size for him to throw high up in the air, get crazy with it and swat it around on the hardwood floors. It's funny to watch him. My Chihuahua likes it, too, but usually only when the cat is playing with it. My dog needs to learn to share!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: incorrect product information
customer_reviews.text: I try not to buy anything made in China and emailed the store to see where the product was made - I received a reply assuring me that the item was made in the U.S. Then I purchased and subsequently received the item and it clearly states on the packaging as well as the tag of the toy itself, that the item was manufactured in China. This merchant can't be trusted and I won't make any other purchases from this merchant in the future. P.S.: the only reason I gave the product 3 stars, is that my cat likes it, but I am leery about any hazardous materials that might be in the toy, which could hurt my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Makes kitty's instinct come out
customer_reviews.text: If it can stand my kittens constantly gnawing on it, it's a good product. And this stood the test. All my four kittens, and both of my older cats love this toy. My older cats don't typically play, but I think the realistic looking tail makes their instinct come out. The instinct is especially true for my kittens, who will snatch the toy up with their mouth and shake their heads like a dog trying to tear it apart. I think it helps stimulate their ~wild~ self. The velcro pouch is convenient for stuffing catnip into too. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Nice Means of Light Exercise for a Geriatric Kitty
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting my 18 yr old kirry some light exercise. She tries as hard as she can, given her age, to get to the catnip inside. Only keeps her engaged for short periods of time, but any activity at 18 is great for her.
customer_reviews.author: LockjawAl

customer_reviews.title: Cats favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the king squirrel toy my mom's cat played with for 7 years. This is his favorite toy. He eventually destroyed the head and tail after 7 years of chewing and kicking! Very durable, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps out kitty occupied and happy.
customer_reviews.text: Our little Sophie got this in her stocking from Santa! She hasn’t stopped playing with it and cuddling it since she got it. Also the Velcro that holds the catnip in is very strong and secure. The thing is completely wet from her licking it, so I was worried about the Velcro opening and catnip falling it but that hasn’t happened yet. Very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Randiiibaby

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect toy
customer_reviews.text: Once my cat stopped playing with the box this came in, I was surprised at how much she plays with this catnip squirrel. It's belly opens up so you can refill the catnip. It has a nice bushy tail that doesn't shed or rub off on carpet. My cat loves to carry this in her mouth and drop it off around the house. The Velcro seal is strong and doesn't drip catnip flakes all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Hedgehog is very popular at my house, even without ...
customer_reviews.text: Hedgehog is very popular at my house, even without the catnip. He's the prey of choice among a houseful of kittens and goes on many adventures. He's carried around the house, dropped from high points (not sure if he's suicidal, being killed, or just being put into motion), and growled over when others try to take him away. He's gone swimming, been dropped in the food bowl, and has generally been put through his paces. He's been through the wash and held up well. He's so popular that I bought extras to give away with the kittens whenever I find homes for them.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good cat toy - our female cat loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves these things. We fill them with catnip, and even after it wears off she still tosses the thing around. I like that it doesn't have a bunch of stuff to tear off and be swallowed. She puts one on the bed where she sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: jfb

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat is obsessed with this toy. I mean, obsessed. Nightly, he "kills" it then carries it around while yelling for us to lavish him with praise. He drowned it in his water bowl once and I threw it away and he was super depressed until I got him another one. And it has to be this one. I got him a mouse. Nope. I got him a bird. No way. Has. To. Be. The. Squirrel. Cats are effing weird.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shropshire

customer_reviews.title: One cat LOVES it, the other is more indifferent.
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat that doesn't really play alone. He loves to play with string and wrestle with his brother, but he doesn't play with any of the stuffed mice or various toys strewn about the house. He LOVES this toy, and guards if from his brother on the rare occasion they both want it. It's fun to watch him toss it in the air and then chase after it. I'm on the second toy, and it's well worth the money. The first one would have lasted longer but they've hidden it, I'm assuming it's with the other missing toys and all my hair ties.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin

customer_reviews.title: New favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased something similar to this several years ago and unfortunately it started looking pretty ragged so it was time to replace it. I love the fact that you can change out the catnip in this toy because it brings new life to it every time. The catnip that came with it was really fresh. My four cats have had this all over the house since it arrived in the mail today. I even caught one using it for a pillow after he wore himself out. I am going to have to buy a few more of these in the other variations to keep my fuzzy babies happy.
customer_reviews.author: MunkyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Mess If the Catnip Container Leaks All Contents Before Arrival!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves his toys, especially the ones filled with catnip. Unfortunately this beaver might have been bored during transit and might have gnawed off the top of the plastic container of catnip. The top on the catnip container was not secured with tape or any kind of wrap, so when I opened the box, catnip went EVERYWHERE--all over me, the floor, the other purchases in the box, my bed. Besides the huge mess, there's no catnip left to stuff inside the beaver for my cat to enjoy. It's only a beaver suit with no catnip innards, and that makes it rather useless. Thanks, Kong. Packaging needs work.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy has already been well played with by my 1 year old cat. It did come with a tube of catnip that the lid came off in the mail. However it was all in the envelope and I just poured it back in. I gave it to my cat who LOVES catnip and she charged around the house killing it again and again. Now if your cat is not into catnip I am not sure that this would be a great toy. I like that I can add catnip to the toy later on. I boughtto keep some extra catnip on hand with this toy. Overall a great purchasse
customer_reviews.author: E.S

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the dog get it!
customer_reviews.text: The cat absolutely loved this toy. It was so fun watching him play with it. I'd definitely buy it again. And in fact... I will buy another one. The idiot dog got ahold of it and it's gone now. I guess it'll come out later but I'm not going to bother digging it out and cleaning it off. I don't think I want my cat playing with that after where it's been anyway...
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Yes, small but thin too. I ordered a rabbit and got a bear. No bear listed either, weird.
customer_reviews.text: ordered a rabbit and got a bear. i wanted the rabbit. it was very small, i knew it was going to be small but not so thin. i have one aggressive cat when it comes to her catnip and i don't think it would of lasted long. unfortunately my cats never got to play with it. i put it in my checked luggage to bring home to Costa Rica and TSA decided to confiscate it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: Any time I see this product, I buy one. It is my cat's favorite toy of all time. We have a stash for the days we lose the other or it gets destroyed. I highly recommend these toys! Both my cats adore it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Saari

customer_reviews.title: Ok cat toy
customer_reviews.text: These little beavers are really cute and I like that they are refillable (Just be aware that they are small) so you can add however much catnip you want. They do get the catnip stuck in the velcro part of the closure and I've noticed that my Luna will play with it for about 10 mins after I refill it and then she's done. I'm not sure if the catnip that comes with it isn't strong enough or she just loses interest.
customer_reviews.author: katrina french

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it but it won’t hold catnip
customer_reviews.text: My cat love it and plays with it regularly. However, it burst open and spilled the cat nip all over within an hour of him getting a hold of it. It wouldn’t stay closed at all after that because catnip bits were stuck in the Velcro so I stopped putting catnip in it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia LeBaron

customer_reviews.title: Where's the catnip?
customer_reviews.text: Just received, so not quite sure how my cats will like. Review is based on receiving the item and tube of catnip was empty-cap was nowhere to be found. There wasn't any catnip pieces in box, so one can only presume toy was shipped with an empty catnip container. Didn't take off more stars because I already have sufficient catnip to keep an entire houseful of cats happy for a very long time ;) so it wasn't a huge disappointment. One would think there would be a way to make sure the tube could be secured so it was received filled and full of catnip, though.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader in IL

customer_reviews.title: Scare all the humans!
customer_reviews.text: Hello humans of Amazon. This is one of the cats. We felines really like this toy so much! It was filled with yummy smelling stuff that had us rolling in joy. But the best part of this toy was yet to come. We placed this creature in our water dish and watched the female human scream in the morning! Ha! We fooled her for sure. She was still sleepy eyed and thought it was a mouse, she really did! So if you want to have fun and watch your humans scream, send your kitty mind signals to them to buy this. You won't regret it. Furredly yours, feline #1
customer_reviews.author: Tee Q

customer_reviews.title: Kong furry refillable catnip toys
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these. We are on our second "Silly Squirrel". He wore most of the fur off the 1st one after 3 years of hard play. He talks to these toys and tosses and drags them all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Conchita C.

customer_reviews.title: ... catnip seems not to interest my cat which is fine, I have a bag
customer_reviews.text: The catnip seems not to interest my cat which is fine, I have a bag. The hedgehog took some time for my cat to begin carrying it around...there's a grey squeaker mouse I bought from another vendor my cat likes alot more. Now that he is playing with it, it seems fine. I put a small puff ball inside the pouch because it lays quite flat without it, even with the catnip. Would do business with this vendor in the future, as well, but if the catnip is old I'd just rather have the toy at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: K. CANNON

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T BEAT THIS PRODUCT AND PRICE! AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely amazing. I was about to complete a checkout, and figured I would give it a shot couldn't beat the price, and if my cats liked it, I figured I had nothing to lose. Long story short, MY CATS LOVE THIS THING!!!!! Will DEF be looking for other products you offer!! Thanks again for an amazing PRODUCT AND PRICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: blizz3010

customer_reviews.title: Beaver Refillable Catnip Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: I received the beaver catnip toy today and it came without a container of catnip, maybe it got lost when they were packing it. I did not return it cause I had a couple other containers of catnip that came with other cat toys I bought and my cat likes it. Maybe the manufacturer will send me a container of catnip, I will just have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: My cat is OBSESSED with this toy. I'm sure that has a lot do with the catnip. My favorite thing about this is that somehow, magically, he can't get the catnip out of the toy. I can't tell you how many times previously I've come home to a shredded cat toy with catnip everywhere. No more! Every month or so I empty out the old catnip and put some new stuff in it. He carries and chases it around all day!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: OMG! He's cute, soft, and cats have gone wacko over hedgehog!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this little guy. He has really different longer soft fur. They like to groom him. Easy to fill, just widen his tummy w your fingers and place his belly OVER the opened vial of catnip and pour some in. Pull vial out, push catnip in further and repeat till empty. He holds the whole vial. I brushed the catnip off the velcro and it sealed tightly. Lots of scurrying and tossing, flipping upside down and rolling, rubbing and drooling will then take place. Mine try to hide it from each other by laying on him. Amazingly loved little toy. Seriously...So well liked I've ordered 5 more!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for fetching and attacking
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these toys. Just the right size for him to carry around and attack. The amount of catnip received is a good size and we keep ours stored in the freezer to keep it fresher longer. He looks forward to hearing the sound of the velcro opening and then the freezer door, as he knows he's going "squirrel hunting". Now that he's getting older and the prey drive is picking up and has had a few run-ins with the glass sliding doors going after real squirrels, he loves being able to catch one laced with catnip:-)
customer_reviews.author: NoVAKim

customer_reviews.title: Instant Hit!
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the bag and my cat went crazy right away. The toy is bit bigger than I anticipated but it doesn't matter. I think the highlight here is the KONG catnip, which I will definitely consider buying more of. I had a generic bag from the pet store but the catnip that came with it seems to be a lot more potent, so I'll give it a look! Smart move on KONG for including that with the toy. It's been about 20 minutes and she's still hanging out with the squirrel. I'll update if I have any quality issues in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great cat toy
customer_reviews.text: My old man cat is really digging this guy (the little lady cat keeps trying to steal it too, but she's got her own toys so I'm showing her away). Word of caution: don't fill this toy anywhere you can't sweep/wipe down, even being careful the 'nip gets everywhere. It probably took only a fifth of the included catnip on the first fill. We try to reduce waste so I really like that this can be refilled
customer_reviews.author: Jacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This squirrel is runner up for best cat-toy that I've been able to find, just behind those silly plastic springs (go figure). Three of the four cats in my house (one, two, and nine years old) go absolutely ballistic over these things! Still the only cat toy that ends up soaked in drool like a dog played with it, they just can't handle themselves! After a while, the fur does start to come off in patches, but I haven't noticed this to cause any problems, and luckily they're cheap to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Justus G Willikers

customer_reviews.title: My catnip addicts adore it
customer_reviews.text: These refillable catnip cuties are scattered throughout the house. In addition to this adorable squirrel, we've got various mice, a froggie and other critters. The Velcro closures are never-fail, and the Kong catnip seems to alway be fresh and lovely, judging by the high feline interest and slitted-eye bliss that follows a play session. If your cat loves catnip, they'll love this one!
customer_reviews.author: kreativ1

customer_reviews.title: Love for this toy made me buy another
customer_reviews.text: This was a definite win of a purchase. While my 2 boys used good cat manners and patiently waited their turn when the other was engrossed with the toy, I went ahead and splurged, ordering them a second one. However, manners have now gone downhill, and there have been moments where I find one of the boys hoarding both squirrels and standing guard over them when the other wants his back. Still a fantastic purchase though.
customer_reviews.author: Brianamal

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very picky about the toys he will play with. He really enjoyed this toy. Tried to turn it on this morning and it won't spin anymore. I've only had it a couple months. I thought maybe I needed to charge it more, but that didn't work. :(
customer_reviews.author: Carla G

customer_reviews.title: My Grandkitty's Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkitty goes NUTS over her "Sonnic" toy! She has had it for a couple of months now and it is still her favorite toy. It seams line the catnip lasts for quite a while so refilling it is not necessary very often...every few weeks should be fine. I also just bought her the duck and squirrel. I love the duck (it's so cute) but she likes the squirrel better. At any rate, these little toys are very well made and stand up to playtime abuse very well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Myers

customer_reviews.title: Best catnip, adorable little critter to stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy for my kitty cats. But the best part is the KONG catnip that comes with it. KONG catnip is the best. My cats go crazy for it but not for any other brand that I have bought for them. So, I'm sticking with KONG. I bought a large tin of Kong Naturals Premium Catnip and they went crazy over it too! Great brand of catnip.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves her beaver!
customer_reviews.text: The catnip beaver is one of my cats absolute favorite toys of all time. I often find Alton playing with her catnip stuffed beaver, she bats the thing around, grabs it in her paws and rolls around with it. It is quiet humerus. We have many cat nip filled toys for the cats, and this one gets by far the most attention. I'm not sure why she loves this more than the others, but it is very evident that she thinks it is a winner! Even after a year of use it has somehow managed to stay intact and more than good enough for our little furry friend!
customer_reviews.author: m cook

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, but weak catnip
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's favorite toy, and in time he shreds them so I was pleased to find a source to get more. The catnip provided is not very strong so anyone who purchases this item for the catnip lure should probably purchase additional catnip elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: judith blair

customer_reviews.title: The product is great. My cat loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. My cat loves this toy. The only problem is that when it arrived the cap on the catnip container was broke off and all the catnip was gone. The package it came in wasn't fully sealed. Some mail carrier out there is probably attracting some happy snazzy cats today! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitty's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my kitty Lily. She wasn't sure quite what to do with it but once she got used to it, she loves playing with it and rolling around with it on the floor. It comes with a small amount of catnip and that lasted us for a while before we had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: EastCobbMama

customer_reviews.title: Here kitty kitty
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this product, but the only thing I would say against it is the ease (or lack thereof) of inserting catnip into the toy itself. The belly opens and is secured by hook and loop fasteners that have a tendency to accumulate catnip, thus rendering them ineffective for closure. Also, with their placement, they are quite difficult to clean. Construction of the toy, however, is solid. Our cat likes to get pretty violent with toys and has yet to tear a seam or a portion of the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Honey

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment for my old kitties!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these. I am glad the come with two because they hid the first one somewhere and I can not find it. So I have tied the second one to a shoe string and to a chair leg to keep it a bit more stationary. The bat at it, rub it, and body slam it. Luckily it isn't a living thing, so it is very adorable to watch instead of horrifying. My cats come back for more love from the Squirrel whenever they feel like it and it seems to really calm them down whenever they get too grumpy!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Owens

customer_reviews.title: cute catnip turtle
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves Mr Turtle! Unfortunately, our dog kinda chewed him up so we got a new one for her. It’s super cute and she likes to fling it around in the air. Even comes with a tube of catnip. Super cute and she rolls around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: My cat gives it two paws up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's cat. I had it with some other unwrapped gifts under the tree. Even without having put catnip in it, my cat dug through and found this squirrel and took off! My cat is 12 and had slowed down quite a bit but this toy brought out the kitten in him again. He had so much fun with it I had to buy my daughter's cat another one!
customer_reviews.author: A. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Did it have to be a beaver?
customer_reviews.text: My cats can't get enough of these dumb things. It's also very odd to tell my friends that my cats love chasing beaver. My cats adore catnip, so everytime I refill these dumb things they go wild. And they're light enough to be toted around at their leisure. I hate that it's a beaver because I can't talk about them with a straight face, but the cats love them so screw it (not the beaver, please).
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best $4 I've spent in quite awhile. Filled it with the catnip that was sent and my older cat spent a good hour licking the squirrel and rubbing his head all over it. Must have been the good stuff. Once I was able to dry it off, the little one kept throwing it around. I highly recommend this toy! It's super easy to refill with catnip and incredibly durable.
customer_reviews.author: JenMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My cat ignores it
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the cat showed interests. Then after like 10 seconds, he walked away and was not interested in it any more even after I threw it right under his nose :((
customer_reviews.author: -J.

customer_reviews.title: Kitten addiction!!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten goes absolutely CRAZY over these beavers...not sure what it is about the beaver that makes her wild, but it's this specific toy she can't get enough of! We have now ordered several as she likes to carry them around in her mouth and stash them. It provides her hours of entertainment as she loves to throw it all around. I highly recommend these beavers!!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: success!
customer_reviews.text: my cats love it, stuffed or not with catnip. they hug it, lick it, bat and chase it, sleep on it, toss it in the air, stalk it, and thankfully do not try to eat it since it does resemble a real critter. it seems to be taking all the abuse well, and it's their favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has gotten some serious abuse out of my cats, but it keeps on going. I was concerned the Velcro would mean catnip all over the place but it's really quite sturdy. I've even tossed it into the washer and let it air dry before refilling it, and it did alright.
customer_reviews.author: The Wicked Witch of the West

customer_reviews.title: The tail might be a choking hazard...
customer_reviews.text: My cats seemed to like this toy, but they were able to tear it open by the velcro seam in only a few months' time. Also, the fuzzy tail, while really cute, ended up being a bit of a hazard, as the cats would rip out the strand of fluff, which would then get stuck in their throats and cause coughing (and a scary choking incident). It seems like the tail material is just thick and long enough to be a problem when it's inevitably swallowed. I replaced this with the KONG Beaver Catnip Toy, and that seems to be much safer.
customer_reviews.author: Science-Minded Multiple Chemical Sensitivities Sufferer

customer_reviews.title: My cats both love this toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats both love this toy. I have a 1 year old cat and one around 4 years old. They can't get enough of these KONG catnip toys. I had to buy a second one because they had absolutely destroyed the first one. A testament to their quality, though, it took them well over 2 years of playing with it regularly to make it unrecognizable. I believe it was originally a squirrel. The turtle has gone over just as well. I will definitely continue to buy these!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My kittens favorite toy. She hasn't acquired an appreciation for catnip yet but loves to play with this toy. I scootch it along as she watches like a real rodent would move and then let it peak out of a blanket and she pounces on it and has fun! I'll be buying another one of these toys when she wears this one out. She has so many toys:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these so much, I have had to buy three; the first has been torn to shreds, and the second was played with so hard, it's apparently gone into hiding, as it has not been seen in a while. The cat flings them all over the house and packs them from room to room so she can give them a proper thrashing. My only complaint is some of the feathers seem to come out fairly quickly, but the cat seems not to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D.

customer_reviews.title: Yes I like it but more importantly the cats LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Yes I like it but more importantly the cats LOVE it. Now if I could just find where they put it I could refill it and get them very happy again. It's not under the chairs, possibly under a bed, possibly under the china cabinet. or God forbid under the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Celtlund

customer_reviews.title: Not a hit with my 3 cats although the product seems good
customer_reviews.text: Although this product was as described, none of my cats so far are willing to play with it, a week after Christmas. I won't editorialize or speculate as to what the issue is since I do not know. The packaging, price, delivery were all good.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the squirrel for years. My cats are on their 3rd or maybe 4th one now in 6 years. It's their favorite. Even after the catnip has lost it's scent they still play with it because they like the tail. I should just buy a case of them.
customer_reviews.author: Serenade

customer_reviews.title: Henry loves feathers and catnip... so this was the perfect toy!
customer_reviews.text: My Henry loves the "Crinkle Ball with Feathers" (also from Amazon - search for them) and he loves his catnip toys, too. So when I saw this "feather catnip mouse" I just had to buy it for him. I barely had it out of the box before he was playing with the feathers and when I finally got it back from him and put the King catnip (a very good brand) in it, he went bonkers! He's fortunately not pulled all of the feathers out, yet. This seems, for some reason, to have more 'durable' feathers than most of his feather toys. Henry loves it, so so do I... that's why it gets five stars!
customer_reviews.author: C B Dyches

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toys EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best cat toys EVER!!! My cat seriously carries these beavers from room to room (we have many). She brings them to me to play catch (ya, what cat plays catch!), she plays with them every day, naps with them, and licks them to care for them. I wake up to a few of these guys at my feet every morning. What is up with these Beavers???? People may not know, cats do. Just buy for your cats and stuff the catnip inside!!! Best cat toy EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved it! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loved this. He is obsessed with catnip and is very playful. We only lost half of the feathers in the past few weeks, but that’s to be expected. The cat could definitely smell the catnip and he loved the feathers. Highly recommend, especially because it is refillable! My cat is 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: The Koeps!

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It, But Always Scaring Humans,
customer_reviews.text: My male cat loves this little thing, tossing it in the air at night etc. But people keep thinking it's a dead mouse on my floor. I am looking for silly refillables that are a little bit bigger and obviously not a little rodent.
customer_reviews.author: Window Kitty

customer_reviews.title: best ever, meow!
customer_reviews.text: This is my one-year old cats favorite toy. He packs hedgehog around with him everywhere he goes. He has three other Kong cat nip toys, but nothing compares to Hedgedog. I've now bought three more as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Meganoodle

product_meta.title: KONG Refillable Catnip Cat Toy
product_meta.description: Color:HedgehogKONG refillable catnip toys utilize top quality, natural North American catnip. These toys have a special compartment that can be opened and closed, so that fresh catnip can be added again and again - to last all of your cat's nine lives. Catnip is a natural, non-addicting herb that encourages play in about 70% of cats, who have an inherited gene that compels them to respond to catnip. For utmost kitty enjoyment, gently twist the filled toy to release catnips' herbal oils. To maintain maximum freshness, freeze extra catnip until needed. Watch your kitty toss, flip, kick and enjoy their new KONG catnip toy. Your cat will love you for it.
feature_bullets: Includes vial of KONG's premium North American catnip
Your cat will love you for it!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
